reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros... Excellent service going beyond to make reservations, etc, nice room, good room view and they upgraded the view for our honeymoon, great resto on site, nice spot to relax outside, Good brekkie included.
reviews.title: A gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Corsican Idyll

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This beautifully located hotel on a large inlet near to the port of porto Vecchio in southern Corsica is charming. Excellent meals from breakfast to dinner are all served on the terrace by the manmade sandy beach and garden ( mind the regularly dropping and exploding pine cones !). The well trained . polite and professional staff were the making of our holiday.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel just a short stroll from the harbour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room #35 we occupied on the first floor had large windows opening out to a fabulous sea view - truly breath taking. The room itself was a little chlaustrohobic for a double superior and the bed was not at all comfortable, like lying on 2 doors with the hinges still attached , loud creaks accompany each move made, poor.
reviews.title: A perfect Experience in Porto Vecchio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the location , 10 minutes walk from the bustling port, the view alone makes this hotel well worth a visit. Over-priced for the room we occupied.
reviews.title: A Lovely spot in the Mediterranean Sean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated about ten minutes walk away from the town of Porto Vecchio on a busy main road. The harbour area has the usual selection of bars and cafes but for real shopping and eating you have to climb up the steep road to the old town where there are some very chic boutiques and a multitude of lively bars and restaurants spread around a mass of narrow streets and alleyways. Although the Goeland is on a main road once inside the hotel gates all is peace and serenity. Miraculously there is very little noise from the traffic.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in an Idyllic Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first impressions of this family hotel were entirely positive. We had booked four nights accommodation through Corsican Places and were greeted by a friendly receptionist who said we had been upgraded to a large room with a sea view although we had only reserved a standard double. Furthermore we had arrived earlier than the required time but our room was ready and the check in formalities were handled very efficiently and speedily. The hotel has a large car park outside so parking was not a problem.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sure enough the view from our first floor room was delightful and the room itself although not huge was clean and charmingly decorated in a rustic, nautical kind of way, a theme reflected throughout the hotel. The bathroom was cavernous by French standards and everything worked OK but I was a bit disappointed there was no proper shower, just one of those hand held things in the bath. The towels were of good quality and changed daily. The bed proved to be very comfortable and we were impressed by how quiet the hotel is, especially at night. The view from the tiny balcony was wonderful with the hills almost enclosing Golfe de Porto-Vecchico on all sides. There were flowers and palms in the garden below and the scent of jasmine and oleander was in the air. Not only is the view stunning but there is always something interesting to see with little boats (and the not so little) going to and fro between the harbour and the open sea.
reviews.title: Great location, on the water

reviews.text: Certain things were lacking in the room. There was not enough storage space. All you get is a small wardrobe with a couple of shelves - no drawers or cupboards. There was no soap dish in the bathroom so there was always a mess around the sink. Also there is an absence of any information about hotel services, laundry arrangements, meal times, local attractions etc. - the sort of thing you get in most hotels.
reviews.title: A small treasure on the water.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has beautiful lawns leading down to the water’s edge with a small beach and sun loungers. There is also a small marina owned I assume by the hotel. The area has bar service with very attentive staff who will bring your drinks out to the lawn where there are plenty of wooden seats and tables, and where you can sit in the shade of the pine trees and watch the ships go by.
reviews.title: Fabulous family hotel, right on the sea.

reviews.text: We stayed for 4 days at the hotel that we found exellent. The location, the kitchen, the nice staff was very good! We stayed in the new building (from last year) in room 36 and 37 with wonderful view over the bay with the little private harbour just under our terrasse. What we missed was a minibar in the room and a breakfast with more choises. We can really recomend this hotel!
reviews.title: Superb location with a family athmosphere

likes.liked: — The location by the private beach/port

reviews.text: Not much to look at from busy road at front, but the rear views are stunning. Has all been refurbished with very attractive, if somewhat small rooms. Works still underway during our visit(April 08.)
reviews.title: Recommended

likes.liked: — rear views and private beach and harbour
likes.disliked: — Close to road, rooms very small and not particularly well equipped for the price

reviews.text: Food good but expensive. The staff were pleasant, but its no good spending lots of money on upgrading the hotel, if you have waitresses wearing the same casual clothes and trainers that they were wearing whilst cleaning the hotel in the morning. A little more style is required in this area.
reviews.title: Very relaxing small hotel on the edge of the sea
Great location, but...........
reviews.text: We spent two nights at the Goeland in April and were very impressed. The location with it's own beach and small harbour is lovely and the views are stunning across the bay.
We had a ground floor room that had both a fan and air-conditioning and its own small shaded terrace. I imagine that the first floor with terraces overlooking the sea are great.
reviews.title: Charming hotel
